messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] listening
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/8/2004 5:58:28 PM Central Standard Time, unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes: Example: When she is told to come right now to me or to
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/8/2004 5:58:28 PM Central Standard Time,
unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com writes:
Example: When she is told to come
right now to me or to the house and she stands and ignores me, goes
on about her business--but the reason she is being told to move in
haste is because a BEAR is in the yard!!!!!! Things like this
***Are you sure about this example? :) I have a very strong willed 5 year
old DD, but I'm sure if I told her the reason I wanted her to come in RIGHT NOW
was because there was a BEAR in the yard...she would come. She's strong
willed, but she's also pretty darned smart :)


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
